p: Teas made with 20–30 g of plant material in 0.5–1 L hot water are used as a tonic, anti-convulsion, against tonsillitis, cold, cough, sore throats, diuretic, digestive, spasmolytic, against stomach and kidney discomforts. It has been also recommended traditionally, against liver diseases, diabetes and obesity ( Liolios et al., 2010). The overall contribution of O. dictamnus flowers is quite small since the most visible element from the inflorescences are the bracts that usually appear together with the leaves in teas.
